clusters.title: Budget standoff over immigration shuts down US Department of Homeland Security
clusters.neutral_headline: ICE agents may have lied about shooting of migrant in Minneapolis, officials say
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Reuters Top News, CBS News and others

items.title: Budget standoff over immigration shuts down US Department of Homeland Security
items.standfirst: A prolonged impasse between US lawmakers over immigration enforcement ensnared the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in a partial government shutdown on Saturday, with Democrats in Congress vowing to withhold funding until major changes are enacted in the wake of two fatal shootings by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis.
items.content: A prolonged impasse between US lawmakers over immigration enforcement ensnared the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in a partial government shutdown on Saturday, with Democrats in Congress vowing to withhold funding until major changes are enacted in the wake of two fatal shootings by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis.

items.title: Why did the Department of Homeland Security shut down? #world
items.standfirst: DHS funding lapse and what it means A lapse in funding took effect after Congress failed to pass a spending measure that both sides could accept, prompting the Department of Homeland Security to begin a partial shutdown at 12:01 a.m. Essential functions tied to national security and emergency…

items.title: 5 things to know about the shutdown at the Department of Homeland Security
items.standfirst: The sprawling agency saw its baseline funding expire after lawmakers left town for a week-long recess, but without a deal to rein in the conduct of federal immigration officers.
items.content: The sprawling agency saw its baseline funding expire after lawmakers left town for a week-long recess, but without a deal to rein in the conduct of federal immigration officers. (Image credit: Alex Wong)

items.title: US homeland security department partially shut down after lawmakers fail to agree funding
items.standfirst: Lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over much-criticized agency’s fundingThe Department of Homeland Security has begun a partial shutdown, after funding for the much-criticized agency expired, with a range of services, including domestic flights and the US Coastguard, now vulnerable to disruption.The shutdown was all but confirmed on Thursday, after the Senate failed to clear the 60-vote threshold needed to pass the DHS appropriations bill and lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving the impasse. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving an impasse over much-criticized agency’s fundingThe Department of Homeland Security has begun a partial shutdown, after funding for the much-criticized agency expired, with a range of services, including domestic flights and the US Coastguard, now vulnerable to disruption.The shutdown was all but confirmed on Thursday, after the Senate failed to clear the 60-vote threshold needed to pass the DHS appropriations bill and lawmakers left Washington for a long weekend without resolving the impasse. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says regime change in Iran ‘would be the best thing’ as US military reportedly plans for operation – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.The annual rate of US inflation eased in January, according to the latest data consumer price index report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). Over the last 12 months, the cost of goods has increased by 2.4% – down from 2.7% in last month’s report.Lawmakers in the House and Senate left Washington on Thursday as the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) heads for another shutdown, when stopgap funding lapses tonight. Nearly all Democrats blocked a second attempt to pass the annual DHS appropriations bill as negotiations for guardrails on federal immigration enforcement have stalled. Senator John Fetterman was the only lawmaker to break ranks with the party. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.The annual rate of US inflation eased in January, according to the latest data consumer price index report from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS). Over the last 12 months, the cost of goods has increased by 2.4% – down from 2.7% in last month’s report.Lawmakers in the House and Senate left Washington on Thursday as the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) heads for another shutdown, when stopgap funding lapses tonight. Nearly all Democrats blocked a second attempt to pass the annual DHS appropriations bill as negotiations for guardrails on federal immigration enforcement have stalled. Senator John Fetterman was the only lawmaker to break ranks with the party. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Second US carrier heads to Middle East
clusters.neutral_headline: Second US carrier heads to Middle East
bullet_summary: US President Donald Trump said Friday that a change in power in Iran "would be the best thing that could happen" as he confirmed the deployment of a second aircraft carrier group to the Middle East
Reported by France24, Reuters Top News, Sky News World and others

items.title: Second US carrier heads to Middle East
items.standfirst: US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner are set to hold talks with Iran in Geneva on Tuesday, as Donald Trump told reporters on Friday that regime change would be the best possible outcome for the country, remarks that come as a second US aircraft carrier is redeployed toward the Middle East from the Caribbean, a journey expected to take at least a week. Peter O'Brien reports.
items.content: US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner are set to hold talks with Iran in Geneva on Tuesday, as Donald Trump told reporters on Friday that regime change would be the best possible outcome for the country, remarks that come as a second US aircraft carrier is redeployed toward the Middle East from the Caribbean, a journey expected to take at least a week. Peter O'Brien reports.

items.title: Trump says Iran regime change 'best thing that could happen' as second carrier heads to region
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Friday that a change in power in Iran "would be the best thing that could happen" as he confirmed the deployment of a second aircraft carrier group to the Middle East. The US president is hoping to strike a deal with Iran to curb its nuclear programme, but has warned of severe consequences if one does not come through.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Friday that a change in power in Iran "would be the best thing that could happen" as he confirmed the deployment of a second aircraft carrier group to the Middle East. The US president is hoping to strike a deal with Iran to curb its nuclear programme, but has warned of severe consequences if one does not come through.

items.title: Trump says second aircraft carrier ‘leaving very shortly’ for Middle East
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday upped the stakes in Washington’s already tense relationship with Iran, saying that a second American aircraft will be “leaving very shortly” for the Middle East. Trump is hoping to strike a deal with Iran to curb its nuclear programme, but has warned of severe consequences if one does not come through.

Trump is hoping to strike a deal with Iran to curb its nuclear programme, but has warned of severe consequences if one does not come through.

items.content: The USS Ford Carrier Strike Group has been notified that they are leaving the Caribbean and headed to the Middle East, according to two U.S. officials familiar with the decision.

bullet_summary: The US and Europe, he said “belong together”

items.title: Munich Security Conference live: Europe must be ready to fight Russia as ‘warning signs are there’, says Starmer
items.standfirst: Russia has shown ‘appetite for aggression’ and possible path for Europe’s future, UK prime minister saysRubio insists that the US “do not seek to separate, but to revitalise an old friendship.”He says “we do not want allies to rationalise the broken status quo rather than reckon with what is necessary to fix it.”“We do not want our allies to be weak, because that makes us weaker. We want allies who can defend themselves, so that no adversary will ever be tempted to test our collective strength. This is why we do not want our allies to be shackled by guilt and shame. Continue reading...
items.content: Russia has shown ‘appetite for aggression’ and possible path for Europe’s future, UK prime minister saysRubio insists that the US “do not seek to separate, but to revitalise an old friendship.”He says “we do not want allies to rationalise the broken status quo rather than reckon with what is necessary to fix it.”“We do not want our allies to be weak, because that makes us weaker. items.title: Rubio tells Europe that US will not abandon transatlantic alliance
items.standfirst: Secretary of state says Washington wants to work ‘together with you, our friends’ on the continent
items.content: Secretary of state says Washington wants to work ‘together with you, our friends’ on the continent

items.title: Rubio tells Europe US wants renewed alliance – but on Trump’s terms
items.standfirst: Secretary of state calls the US ‘a child of Europe’ and urges continent to back a new world orderMunich security conference live: Europe must be ready to fight Russia as ‘warning signs are there’, says StarmerThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has described America as “a child of Europe” and made an emotional but highly conditional offer of a new partnership, insisting the two continents belong together.In a much-anticipated speech at the annual Munich Security Conference, he said the US was intent on building a new world order, adding “while we are prepared, if necessary, to do this alone, it is our preference and it is our hope to do this together with you, our friends here in Europe”. The US and Europe, he said “belong together”. Continue reading...
items.content: Secretary of state calls the US ‘a child of Europe’ and urges continent to back a new world orderMunich security conference live: Europe must be ready to fight Russia as ‘warning signs are there’, says StarmerThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has described America as “a child of Europe” and made an emotional but highly conditional offer of a new partnership, insisting the two continents belong together.In a much-anticipated speech at the annual Munich Security Conference, he said the US was intent on building a new world order, adding “while we are prepared, if necessary, to do this alone, it is our preference and it is our hope to do this together with you, our friends here in Europe”. The US and Europe, he said “belong together”. Continue reading...

items.title: Rubio reassures trans-Atlantic ties with Europe at Munich Security Conference
items.standfirst: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered a calm and reassuring message to America's allies in Munich, after more than a year of President Donald Trump's often-hostile rhetoric toward allies.
items.content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered a calm and reassuring message to America's allies in Munich, after more than a year of President Donald Trump's often-hostile rhetoric toward allies.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: Replay: Europe and the US 'belong together', Rubio tells Munich Security Conference
items.standfirst: US Secretary of ​State Marco Rubio gave a ​robust message of unity with Europe on Saturday at the Munich Security ​Conference, ‌saying Washington's destiny ⁠was intertwined with Europe and that it had ‌no intention of abandoning the Transatlantic ⁠alliance. Watch his full address.
items.content: US Secretary of ​State Marco Rubio gave a ​robust message of unity with Europe on Saturday at the Munich Security ​Conference, ‌saying Washington's destiny ⁠was intertwined with Europe and that it had ‌no intention of abandoning the Transatlantic ⁠alliance. Watch his full address.

items.title: Live: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky to address Munich Security Conference
items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to address the Munich Security Conference on Saturday as Washington steps up pressure on Kyiv and Moscow to end the war that has raged for four years. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio earlier sought to reassure nervous European allies, telling the annual gathering that the US and Europe "belong together". Follow our live blog for the latest developments.
items.content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to address the Munich Security Conference on Saturday as Washington steps up pressure on Kyiv and Moscow to end the war that has raged for four years. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio earlier sought to reassure nervous European allies, telling the annual gathering that the US and Europe "belong together". Follow our live blog for the latest developments.

items.title: US doesn't want to separate from Europe 'but revitalise' alliance, Rubio tells allies
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio sought to assuage European leaders' worries about fraying ties with Washington as he addressed the Munich Security Conference on Saturday, telling the annual gathering that Europe and the US "belong together" and that Washington wants to "revitalise" the transatlantic alliance.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio sought to assuage European leaders' worries about fraying ties with Washington as he addressed the Munich Security Conference on Saturday, telling the annual gathering that Europe and the US "belong together" and that Washington wants to "revitalise" the transatlantic alliance.

items.title: Bangladesh's Tarique Rahman poised to become PM as Islamists concede defeat
items.standfirst: Bangladesh's largest Islamist party conceded defeat in elections on Saturday, despite earlier alleging problems with the vote count, clearing the way for Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader Tarique Rahman to become prime minister after 17 years in self-imposed exile.
items.content: Bangladesh's largest Islamist party conceded defeat in elections on Saturday, despite earlier alleging problems with the vote count, clearing the way for Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader Tarique Rahman to become prime minister after 17 years in self-imposed exile.

items.title: Can Bangladesh's new leader bring change after election landslide?

clusters.title: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
clusters.neutral_headline: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
bullet_summary: If the list is reposted, they said it would be a show of strength ahead of President Donald Trump’s expected trip to China and meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in April
Asked about the notice, the Pentagon said in a statement to Bloomberg News that “we have nothing to announce at this time

items.title: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
items.standfirst: The Pentagon added Alibaba, BYD, Baidu and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation. The moves on Friday roiled shares of the affected listed companies and left analysts wondering about the administration’s intentions. If the list is reposted, they said it would be a show of strength ahead of President Donald Trump’s expected trip to China and meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in April. Asked about the notice, the Pentagon said in a statement to Bloomberg News that “we have nothing to announce at this time.” Bloomberg News Senior Editor for Technology & Strategic Industries Michael Shepard joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: The Pentagon added Alibaba, BYD, Baidu and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation. The moves on Friday roiled shares of the affected listed companies and left analysts wondering about the administration’s intentions. If the list is reposted, they said it would be a show of strength ahead of President Donald Trump’s expected trip to China and meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in April. Asked about the notice, the Pentagon said in a statement to Bloomberg News that “we have nothing to announce at this time.” Bloomberg News Senior Editor for Technology & Strategic Industries Michael Shepard joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: US concludes Alibaba and BYD have links to Chinese military
items.standfirst: The companies are among a number the Pentagon believes could pose a threat to American national security
items.content: The companies are among a number the Pentagon believes could pose a threat to American national security

items.title: US Briefly Names Alibaba, Baidu as Firms Aiding China’s Military
items.standfirst: The Pentagon added Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., BYD Co., Baidu Inc. and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation.
items.content: The Pentagon added Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., BYD Co., Baidu Inc. and TP-Link Technologies Co. to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military – before withdrawing it minutes later without explanation.

clusters.title: Don Lemon says "I will not be intimidated" after pleading not guilty to church protest charges
clusters.neutral_headline: Ex-CNN host Don Lemon pleads not guilty in Minnesota church protest case
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, BBC World

items.title: Don Lemon says "I will not be intimidated" after pleading not guilty to church protest charges
items.standfirst: Independent journalist and former CNN anchor Don Lemon pleaded not guilty Friday to federal charges stemming from his coverage of a protest in a Minnesota church. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano reports.
items.content: Independent journalist and former CNN anchor Don Lemon pleaded not guilty Friday to federal charges stemming from his coverage of a protest in a Minnesota church. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano reports.

items.title: Ex-CNN host Don Lemon pleads not guilty in Minnesota church protest case
items.standfirst: The former CNN host and eight others have been charged for interrupting a church service to protest immigration raids in the state.
items.content: The former CNN host and eight others have been charged for interrupting a church service to protest immigration raids in the state.

clusters.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies
clusters.neutral_headline: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies

items.title: #CIA: Video aims to recruit #Chinese military officers as spies
items.standfirst: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.
items.content: The #CIA has posted a video on its YouTube channel targeting members of the #Chinese military in an attempt to #recruit them as spies. The video depicts a fictional disillusioned Chinese military officer who decides to contact the CIA and comes after a recent dramatic purge of China's top generals.

items.title: China vows to take 'measures' against spying after CIA recruitment video
items.standfirst: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.
items.content: The CIA released a Chinese-language recruitment video targeting disaffected Chinese military officers, showing a fictional officer deciding to contact the agency to expose leadership lies. The clip encourages leaks on China’s leaders and military. Beijing reacted angrily, warning it will take all necessary measures to counter foreign espionage.

items.title: CIA makes new push to recruit spies from Chinese military
items.standfirst: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.
items.content: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.

clusters.title: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first vote since overthrow of Hasina
clusters.neutral_headline: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first vote since overthrow of Hasina
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Sky News World

items.title: Bangladesh election: BNP wins historic first vote since overthrow of Hasina
items.standfirst: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...
items.content: Voting was largely peaceful in an election seen as a test of Bangladesh’s democracy after years of political turmoil The Bangladesh Nationalist party, led by Tarique Rahman, has won a sweeping victory in the country’s first election since a gen Z uprising toppled the autocratic regime of Sheikh Hasina.Results from the election commission confirmed the BNP alliance had won 212 seats, returning the party to power after 20 years, while the rival alliance, led by the Islamist party Jamaat-e-Islami, won 77 seats. Continue reading...

items.title: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party wins majority in historic election
items.standfirst: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.
items.content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has secured a majority victory in the country's first election since the Gen Z-driven uprising of 2024.
